intro: Lochnera lancea, commonly known as the slender lochnera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, erect stems with palmately lobed leaves that have a velvety texture. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Lochnera lancea is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodland edges and wetlands.
